name: mweinberg
cooked:
Hi Kapena.

This situation is one of the main reasons that OSHWA created the certification program (see: https://www.oshwa.org/2015/09/24/what-oshwa-is-and-is-not-trying-to-do-with-the-open-source-hardware-certification/). Since no one controls the term “open source hardware,” anyone can use it however they want. However, only hardware that complies with the community definition of open source hardware and has passed the certification process can use OSHWA’ open source hardware certification logo.
raw:
Hi Kapena.

This situation is one of the main reasons that OSHWA created the certification program (see: https://www.oshwa.org/2015/09/24/what-oshwa-is-and-is-not-trying-to-do-with-the-open-source-hardware-certification/).  Since no one controls the term "open source hardware," anyone can use it  however they want.  However, only hardware that complies with the community definition of open source hardware and has passed the certification process can use OSHWA' open source hardware certification logo.
